Campus Comment

A Southerner in York

I don't care for regional pride, because I believe the logical extension of these is arbitrary conflict, like the clashing of football firms or religious sects.

York's political apathy

This university's lack of interest in campus politics is a dire shame, yet we are being given the opportunities to make a huge difference to our experiences here.

York needs to take charge of where the money goes

We desperately need to change this disparity between ethical consumption and ethical investment. We wouldn't buy something which we knew had been made using forced labour, so why do people still invest in it?

The perks of being a mature student

Accepting the label of a 'mature student' takes courage, but it comes with its own advantages

Let's STYC together

Zain Mahmood responds to Ellie Rice's attack on the STYC system.

Will more Wednesdays end in Ziggy's than Salvation?

Ziggy's secures the top spot for the Wednesday "end-of-night venue" and just under 1 in 10 students don't cook any of their own meals. Fiona Parker examines the latest Nouse polls.

The state of student employment

'Human zoo' betrays a skewed Vision of mental health

<em>Vision</em>'s article, which likened the event to a 'human zoo', has been met by fierce controversy, with several students deeming the terminology used 'offensive', and others believing those interviewed to have a misguided conception of what the event will entail.

Come dine with the VC

The perversion of the freshers experience

For the modern generation, bed -post notches are worn like badges of honour, hangovers with pride rather than shame, and promiscuous individuals are given hearty pats on the back by their giggling mates as last night's 'conquest' scurries down the hall back to wherever they came from, with panda eyes and ripped tights.

Taking credit for hardship funds

It is very easy to be generous with other people's money ...

Shambles on the Shambles

If we can't save our cobbles, perhaps we should learn a lesson about town planning and pay more attention to future schemes put forward by the council.

A STYCy situation

University oversight risks our reputation

With tuition fees now at PS9000 a year, departments will be expected to provide the very best for their students. This will be incredibly challenging when one considers they will be providing for more students than they can physically cater for.

The University's response to student accommodation concerns

The University's Academic Registrar explains the current situation regarding first-year accommodation shortages.

The positive side to private accommodation

While the intimate bonding that an extravagantly be-pubed bog engenders is something to treasure, it's not the be all and end all of fresher interaction.

There is no excuse for Freshers' accommodation shortfall

The University has been greedy, accepting more students than it can accommodate, and Freshers may miss out on a key part of the first year experience.

Cookbooks: a first-year priority

A fresh look: small fish in a big, clever pond

For the past 18 months, I've been so busy thinking about applying to university, getting offers and then getting the necessary grades that I almost forgot about this bit; actually having to go.

First-years: ignore our advice

I worry when I see people in my own position giving advice about what's important in your first year of university. With only a third of our time at university behind us, it's difficult to even say whether it will have had that big an effect on our own university experience, let alone our whole life. And certainly not someone else's.

Encourage first years to have their own freshers' experience

Poll Results: Modafinil Use and the NUS Conference

We asked whether you took Modafinil last term, and whether the NUS National Conference was worth the money. Tom Witherow unpicks the results.

Summer going home, but I'm staying put

No expenses spared, evidently

Figures obtained on the University's expenses provide a worrying correlation between the deterioration of campus and the University's involvement

Do you believe in life after exams?

Lots of these activities are only fun when you've actually got something more important to do instead

A BA Bereavement

Like it or not university is a bubble, and by the time you finish your finals, that bubble has burst

We need to be smarter about campus feminism

If feminism is ever going to achieve its aims, men have to be part of the conversation

The case for drug legalisation

Who's afraid of racial equality?

By James Bithell

When presented with the BME statistics York claimed that that the difference was not done by them. Responsibility was abandoned, and whilst it appears that the University is doing nothing wrong, York doesn't appear to be doing anything right either.

Finding the funding

By James Bithell
